title: India A vs England Lions, 2nd Unofficial Test Day 3 Highlights: Abhimanyu Easwaran, KL Rahul Slams 50s As India A Reach 163/4
description: India A vs England Lions, 2nd Unofficial Test Day 3, Live Updates: Abhimanyu Easwaran and KL Rahul's half-centuries steered India A to extend their lead to 184.
excerpt: India A vs England Lions, 2nd Unofficial Test Day 3, Live Updates: Abhimanyu Easwaran and KL Rahul's half-centuries steered India A to extend their lead to 184.
text: India A vs England Lions, 2nd Unofficial Test Day 3 Highlights© X (Twitter) India A vs England Lions, 2nd Unofficial Test Day 3 Highlights: Abhimanyu Easwaran and KL Rahul's half-centuries steered India A to extend their lead over England Lions on Day 3 of their 2nd Unofficial Test in Northampton. At stumps at the County Ground, the visitors led by 184 runs with a full day's play left in the match. Easwaran hit a quickfire 80 while Rahul, who scored a 116 in the first innings, added another 51 to his tally. Earlier, left-arm pacer Khaleel Ahmed produced a penetrating spell of seam bowling, returning with figures of 4/70 as England Lions were bowled out for 327, handing India A a 21-run first-innings lead. The Lions resumed their innings from 192/3 on Day 3 of the second Unofficial Test against India A in Northampton, trailing by 156 runs. Earlier on Day 2, bad light forced an early stumps after India A were bundled out for 348. Emilio Gay top-scored for England Lions with 71 off 117 balls. (Scorecard) Topics mentioned in this article
html:
India A vs England Lions, 2nd Unofficial Test Day 3 Highlights© X (Twitter)

India A vs England Lions, 2nd Unofficial Test Day 3 Highlights: Abhimanyu Easwaran and KL Rahul's half-centuries steered India A to extend their lead over England Lions on Day 3 of their 2nd Unofficial Test in Northampton. At stumps at the County Ground, the visitors led by 184 runs with a full day's play left in the match. Easwaran hit a quickfire 80 while Rahul, who scored a 116 in the first innings, added another 51 to his tally. Earlier, left-arm pacer Khaleel Ahmed produced a penetrating spell of seam bowling, returning with figures of 4/70 as England Lions were bowled out for 327, handing India A a 21-run first-innings lead. The Lions resumed their innings from 192/3 on Day 3 of the second Unofficial Test against India A in Northampton, trailing by 156 runs. Earlier on Day 2, bad light forced an early stumps after India A were bundled out for 348. Emilio Gay top-scored for England Lions with 71 off 117 balls. (Scorecard)
